scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. Your colleague, Mark, messages: 'Hey Alex, I really need your help with this urgent task. Can you help me out?' You responded, 'Mark, I'm currently on leave. Can you ask someone else, or can it wait until I return?' Mark replies, 'I understand you're off, but there's really no one else who can handle this as well as you. It's quite critical.' You agreed to help and asked Mark to send you the details.
scenes.description: After reviewing the task details, you realize it's more extensive than you initially thought. Mark messages again, 'Alex, any update on the task? We really need it done ASAP.'

options.text: I'm working on it. It's quite detailed, so it might take a bit longer than expected.
options.analysis: You showed empathy and emotional perception by updating Mark on the task, but your self-regulation could be improved as you continue to work during your leave.

options.text: Mark, this is taking longer than expected. Can you get someone to help with parts of it?
options.analysis: You maintained good self-regulation by asking for assistance, but showed less empathy and motivation towards the task.

options.text: I'll keep working on it, but please make sure to allocate such tasks better in the future.
options.analysis: You balanced empathy and self-regulation well, and communicated your availability clearly, showing good social skills.
